docs.snippet: The Chicago Cubs last won a World Series championship in 1908, when Teddy Roosevelt was president....
docs.lead_paragraph: The Chicago Cubs last won a World Series championship in 1908, when Teddy Roosevelt was president.
docs.abstract: Michael Powell Sports of The Times column discusses how Chicago Cubs rallied in ninth inning to defeat San Francisco Giants, 6-5, and secured their spot in National League Championship Series; notes team has not won World Series since 1908..

headline.main: In the Cubs’ Clubhouse, No Worries About a Curse or a Goat
headline.print_headline: Brushing Aside the Giants, Doubt and Talk of Curses

docs.snippet: President Vladimir V. Putin outlined a broad strategy this week to redeem Russia in the eyes of global Olympic officials in the wake of its doping controversy....
docs.lead_paragraph: President Vladimir V. Putin outlined a broad strategy this week to redeem Russia in the eyes of global Olympic officials in the wake of its doping controversy.
docs.abstract: Russian Pres Vladimir V Putin outlines strategy to redeem his country with Olympic officials after its track and field team was banned from Rio Olympics; move comes after former director of Russia's antidoping laboratory Grigory Rodchenkov outlined scheme to cheat carried out by Russian state.

headline.main: Russian Olympic Chief to Step Down; Putin Hints at Other Changes
headline.print_headline: Putin Looks to Return Russia to Olympic Fold

byline.contributor: Ivan Nechepurenko contributed reporting from Moscow.

docs.snippet: West Ham United defenders Aaron Cresswell and Havard Nordtveit, and striker Jonathan Calleri have returned to full training but Turkish winger Gokhan Tore will be out for up to six weeks with a quadriceps injury, the club said on its website....
